SUITE tokens to get credits for app usage Two user paths: 1. Crypto users: Buy SUITE on Uniswap, then stake() 2. owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unstake(uint256).details: Used credits are burned, remaining SUITE is returned

params.amount: Amount of staked SUITE to withdraw Example: staked=100, used=30, unstake(50) - Burns min(50, 30) = 30 from used credits - Returns 50 - 30 = 20 SUITE to user - New state: staked=50, used=0

authorizeApp(address).notice: Authorize an app to spend user credits

authorizedApps(address).notice: Apps authorized to spend user credits

availableCredits(address).notice: Get available credits for a user

buy(uint256).notice: Buy SUITE tokens with USDC (sent to wallet, not staked)

buyAndStake(uint256).notice: Buy SUITE with USDC and automatically stake it

setSuitePerUsdc(uint256).notice: Update the SUITE per USDC rate

stake(uint256).notice: Stake SUITE tokens to receive credits

stakedBalance(address).notice: Total SUITE staked by each user

suitePerUsdc().notice: SUITE tokens per USDC (e.g., 1000 = 1 USDC buys 1000 SUITE)

useCredits(address,uint256).notice: Deduct credits from a user (called by authorized apps)

usedCredits(address).notice: Credits consumed by each user (tracked separately, burned on unstake)
